title: Rush Hour: How 500 Million Commuters Survive the Daily Journey
description:
Rush Hour: How 500 Million Commuters Survive the Daily Journey to Work by Iain Gately

Requirements: ePUB reader, 2.2 MB

Overview: Each working day 500 million people across the planet experience the miracle and misery of commuting. Whether undertaken by car, bus, train or bicycle, the practice shapes our days and creates a time and a space for a surprisingly diverse range of activities.

In RUSH HOUR, Iain Gately traces the past, present and future of commuting, from the age of Dickens to the potential of the driverless car. He examines the contrasting experiences of commuters in Britain and elsewhere in the world: from the crush-loaded salarymen of the Tokyo metro to the road-rage afflicted middle managers of America
